what: available: Check if the Title of a Package is Available, Appropriate and Interesting — available-package
title: available: Check if the Title of a Package is Available, Appropriate and Interesting — available-package
text: Check given package name available use. checks name's validity. Checks used 'GitHub', 'CRAN' 'Bioconductor'. Checks unintended meanings querying 'Wiktionary' Wikipedia.

title: available: Check if the Title of a Package is Available, Appropriate and Interesting — available-package
text: Maintainer: Gábor Csárdi csardi.gabor@gmail.com Authors: Carl Ganz Jim Hester Molly Lewis Rachael Tatman

what: See if a name is available — available
title: See if a name is available — available
text: Searches performed Valid package name Already taken CRAN Positive negative sentiment

title: See if a name is available — available
See if a name is available — available
text: name Name package search browse Whether browser opened web links, default = TRUE. Default can changed setting available.browse .Rprofile. See Startup details. ... Additional arguments passed utils::available.packages().

title: See if a name is available — available
code: if (FALSE) { # Check if the available package is available available("available")  # You can disable opening of browser windows with browse = FALSE available("survival", browse = FALSE)  # Or by setting a global option options(available.browse = FALSE) available("survival")  # Test if a name is available in a non-default CRAN repository by setting # the `repos` argument available_on_cran("semaforos")  available_on_cran("semaforos", repos = "https://bisaloo.r-universe.dev") }

title: See if a name is available on CRAN — available_on_bioc
code: available_on_cran("semaforos") #> Available on CRAN: ✔   # Test if this name is available in a non-default CRAN repository if (FALSE) { available_on_cran("semaforos", repos = "https://bisaloo.r-universe.dev") }

title: Suggest a package name based on a development package title or description — suggest
code: if (FALSE) { # Default will use the title from the current path. suggest()  # Can also suggest based on the description suggest(field = "Description") }  # Or by explicitly using the text argument suggest(   text =     "A Package for Displaying Visual Scenes as They May Appear to an Animal with Lower Acuity" ) #> displayingrvis

title: available 1.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-07-10 Removed Urban Dictionary support, udapi package set archived.

title: available 1.0.5
text: CRAN release: 2021-11-30 Gábor Csárdi now maintainer. get_wikipidia() renamed get_wikipedia(). valid_package_name() now correctly checks package name according CRAN policy (@KevCaz, #61).

title: available 1.0.4
text: CRAN release: 2019-07-19 Tests requiring network access now skipped CRAN.

title: available 1.0.3
text: CRAN release: 2019-07-01 BiocManager now preferred BiocInstaller installed (#44, @luciorq). create() now uses usethis::create_package() rather deprecated devtools::create().

title: available 1.0.2
text: CRAN release: 2018-11-08 Add dialog run interactively asking urban dictionary results included, can potentially contain offensive results (#41). Use BiocManager compatibility future versions R.

title: available 1.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2018-07-16 Filter repo GitHub results (#21). get_urban_data() now exported (#34). longer trimming r R proceeded vowel search terms, originally intended (#35). Support upcoming glue 1.3.0 release

title: available 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-11-17 Initial release
